Our first responders make sacrifices every day to keep our communities safe.

It's on us to not only express our gratitude but ensure we enact legislation to make their jobs as safe as possible. Let's get this done.

The adoption of fire sprinklers in the last 40 years has led to an almost 50% reduction in fire deaths in the US.

Yet, we continue to see far too many firefighter and resident deaths that are caused by fires spreading in older high-rise buildings due to a lack of sprinklers.

The current tax code treats fire sprinklers the same as plumbing and their costs are depreciated over 39 years.

Our High-Rise Fire Sprinkler Incentive Act simply decreases this cost recovery to 15 years, incentivizing building owners to install fire sprinklers.

üö®BIG NEWS: I joined @BillPascrell & @RepJohnKatko today in introducing bipartisan legislation to protect our firefighters.

This bill amends the tax code to create a new incentive for owners to install sprinklers in residential buildings that were erected before fire codes.üßµüëá

Now @RonWyden‚Äôs Billionaire Tax comes in. Roughly 700 households would pay it, & many of them gained wealth during the pandemic by watching the market go up.

Would generate ~$500B, close to the bare minimum we need for better tech & a more capable military than China. (7/8)

Add that to our latest defense bill, which costs $200B above what we spent in 2015.

These increases in spending quickly get to $500B, & the experts I‚Äôve talked to consider this a bare minimum. (6/8)

The military needs new tech platforms, new drones & ships & cyber capabilities. 

And because people win wars, we need to fund new training & retention programs to make sure we have the best & the brightest, & not everyone gets hired away to Silicon Valley. (4/8)

Because this is a new challenge, we need new investments to meet it.

PA institutions like @NETL_DOE & @CarnegieMellon need new funding to invent, research & develop solutions to difficult problems in energy & cybersecurity, among others. (3/8)

We‚Äôve never faced a threat like China. They‚Äôre far larger than us or Soviets ever were, & their theft of our tech has let them surpass us in key technologies like hypersonic missiles & AI, among others.
